body.p: In making this decision not to include materiality guidance in IFRS 16, the IASB noted that a lessee would not be required to apply the recognition and measurement requirements in IFRS 16 if the effect of doing so would not be material to its financial statements. Similarly, if a lessee’s leasing activities are material to its financial statements, but the effect of measuring lease liabilities on a discounted basis is not material, the lessee would not be required to measure its lease liabilities on a discounted basis and could instead, for example, measure them on an undiscounted basis.
